# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for the function `clean_column` that cleans a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```

This function works by first converting all characters to lower case using the `lowercase` function, then removing any leading or trailing whitespaces with `strip`. It replaces any sequence of spaces and hyphens with a single underscore using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]+"` matches one or more occurrences of space or hyphen characters.
